Directions
In a medium bowl, whisk Prosecco, Aperol, water, orange juice, lemon juice, and sugar together to combine, stirring until sugar has dissolved, about 1 minute. Pour into an 8- by 8- inch square or 9- by 13-inch glass or ceramic baking dish. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the freezer until partially frozen, about 1 hour.
Serious Eats / Deli Studios
Run a fork through the mixture and around the edges of the pan, taking care to break up any large ice chunks. Return pan to freezer and repeat process every 30 minutes until little to no liquid remains, 4 to 5 hours. (The total time will vary depending on the temperature of your freezer and the size of your pan.)
Serious Eats / Deli Studios
Serve in Champagne coupes or martini glasses. Garnish each glass with fresh mint leaves and an orange slice, if desired. For a slushy beverage, top each glass with a splash of seltzer or sparkling water.
Serious Eats / Deli Studios
Special Equipment
8- by 8- inch or 9- by 13-inch freezer-safe glass, ceramic, or metal dish, plastic wrap
Notes
Since Prosecco loses its effervescence once frozen, a dry or semi-sweet white wine may be used in its place for a similar effect.
If using store-bought juice, look for pulp-free or low-pulp juice. To remove pulp from freshly squeezed orange and lemon juice, strain juice through a fine-mesh sieve; discard pulp or reserve for other use.
The freezing time will depend on the temperature of your freezer and the size of your pan.
